instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PP3V3_S4_IPD: What is PP3V3_S4_IPD? PP3V3_S4_IPD is a 3.3v power rail for powering the trackpad and keyboard on a Macbook Air. If the keyboard and trackpad are not powering, check the resistor that functions as a fuse between PP3V3_S4 and PP3V3_S4_IPD as it may have blown. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. On/Off Button triggers but keyboard mouse not working.

Installed the board on a different chasis altogether to rule out any part issue. But still the same.

Also changed the flex but still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message: TP/KB not working in boot menu also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message: Unable to enter boot menu or recovery mode because keyboard not responding. On/Off Button still works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Then check L4820 and <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>.
You can try to bypass them.
Be sure to get all power rails at J4800.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
J4800 Power Rails all are okay.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_IPD</SIGNAL> is at 2.9V. Shouldnt it be 3.3V ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Tied Point 1 and Point 2 of L4820
Did the same for <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>.

No Change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Keep them bypassed.

Do you get 3V at pin 1/J4800?
Check voltage at pins 12 & 15, before and after macOS started.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Before and After Macos Started
Pin 13 is 2.5V and Pin 15 is 3.3V

Getting Pin 3.4V on Pin 1

I dont know how i missed it but there is corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C8000</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.

Although diode mode reading of <CAPACITOR>C8000</CAPACITOR> is 0.257

<CHIP>U8000</CHIP> just fell off the board. Let me replace it and get back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
threads.message:
Having a weird problem here. Some keys working when entering the password but not working post Macos login.

Example a,i 0 8 etc.

What can be the issue ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Keyboard Mouse
